Event: A lonely, isolating, hopeless, regretful, shameful, heart-breaking, suicide-inducing experience.
Post: "I'm so stuck in this rut of sadness and loneliness. I feel like I'll never be able to break free from this dark cloud that's been following me everywhere. Everything I do seems to turn out wrong, and I can't help but wonder if it's all worth it.  I'm just so tired of feeling like a failure in every aspect of my life."

Event: Constant expectation of bad things happening.
Post: "I'm starting to think that nothing good ever happens to me. I failed my math test, and now I'm probably going to fail every other test too. I'll never get into a good college or have a successful career. #failure #badluck #nevergoodenough"

Event: feeling empty and alone despite having a job and a loving partner, struggling with existential dread and meaninglessness.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut, and it seems like nothing can fill this void. I have a good job and a loving partner, but it's like that's not enough. I can't shake off this feeling of emptiness and meaninglessness. It's like everything is just a facade, and I'm just going through the motions. Maybe it's because I failed to achieve my dreams or maybe it's just the existential dread that comes with being human. Either way, it feels like I'm drowning in an ocean of uncertainty."

Event: A lonely and boring day that left the individual feeling unmotivated and hopeless.

Event:
...[NONE]

Explanation: The sentence does not contain an event as it is a statement of negation and self-defeating thoughts. There is no specific occurrence or situation mentioned that could be considered an event.
Post:
"I'm such a failure. I can't even get anything right."

This post attributes the cause of the individual's perceived failure to their own inherent inadequacy, implying that they are destined to fail in all aspects of their life. It is an example of a global attributional style because it generalizes a specific event (failing a math test) to the individual's entire life, suggesting that they are doomed to be a failure forever.

Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone, like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. I've been through so much already, from witnessing assaults to losing loved ones to cancer.
